definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
Li (c. 2000 BC), sixth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God, also known as Ai 哀[Ai1]

sentences.english: It was, for the most part, silly and graced by the current slang.
sentences.chinese: 那些话大部分愚蠢无聊，夹杂着流行的市井喱语。

sentences.english: One pound troy contains 12 ounces or 5760 grains.
sentences.chinese: 一金衡磅等于十二盎司或5760喱。

definition: dialectal equivalent of 沒有|没有[mei2 you3]
phonetic ga (used in rendering Tibetan and Mongolian sounds)/Tibetan Ge: language of Buddha/(dialect) final particle similar to 了[le5] (esp. in Yunnan)
move the mouth as in speaking
phonetic character used in loanwords for the sound "jia", although 夹 is more common
to squint/what? (Cantonese)/see also 乜嘢[mie1 ye3]
(onom.) for the sound of a bird, an empty stomach etc
onomat. for surprise, amazement and sigh
